intro: Disperis teleplana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Disperis teleplana is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in indoor environments.
